response.overview: The wild and breathtaking scenery of Austria's Roman Quarry of St. Margarethen provides an ideal and unique backdrop for this live and colourful open-air performance of Georges Bizet's opera Carmen (1875). With over 400 participants, this opulent staging of Bizet's famous opera - one of the most popular works in the genre's history - proves a feast for all the senses. Austria's Opera Festival St. Margarethen, one of Europe's most important open-air festivals, is attended by about 220, 000 opera lovers every year. Conductor: Ernst MÃ¤rzendorfer. Soloists: Nadia Krasteva, Russi Nikov, Alexandrs Antonenko. Choreography: Marieta Romero Opera.
response.title: Carmen
